JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by their Agent , PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant bought a house together with the underlying plot of land which was formally QUANTITY wide and QUANTITY long .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the Head of ORG , apparently in reply to an inquiry made by a private law firm , informed the person concerned that , following an on - site examination , it had been established that , according to the relevant plan , the applicant ’s plot of land measured CARDINAL sq . m , but in reality it measured QUANTITY m , not including the walls , and QUANTITY . m , if including the walls . The width of the plot at the front was QUANTITY , while the middle part , CARDINAL along , was QUANTITY wide . It was also established that the owners of the neighbouring houses had seized part of the applicant ’s plot of land : CARDINAL sq . m , not including the walls , and QUANTITY . m , if including the walls .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant instituted proceedings before the ORG and ORG of GPE against his neighbours , claiming that they had built certain constructions encroaching on his plot of land , and seeking to recover his property .
CARDINAL . During the court examination of the claim it was established that the constructions in question were the ORG houses which were owned by them .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG and ORG of GPE partially granted his claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed his claim in full .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed this judgment and remitted the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having re - examined the claim , decided to grant it . The court found that , according to the relevant property certificate and the plot ’s plan , the applicant ’s plot of land measured QUANTITY However , as stated in ORG letter of DATE , his neighbours had unlawfully seized part of that plot measuring CARDINAL sq . m , not including the walls , and QUANTITY . m , if including the walls . The court thus obliged the defendants to remove the unauthorised constructions and to return the unlawfully seized part of the plot of land according to the dimensions indicated in the letter of DATE .
CARDINAL . No appeal was lodged against this judgment and it became final . A corresponding writ of execution was issued to the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG of ORG ( “ the LOC ” ) to institute enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff decided to institute the relevant enforcement proceedings . On the same date the bailiff ordered the applicant ’s neighbours to demolish the unauthorised constructions and to return the seized part of the plot of land to the applicant by TIME on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff decided to impose on the neighbours a fine of QUANTITY ( approx . EUR CARDINAL ) due to their failure to comply with the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff instituted court proceedings , seeking to have this fine levied .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG and ORG of GPE left the bailiff ’s application unexamined due to his failure to appear .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff decided to apply to ORG with a request to clarify the execution writ , stating that on DATE the defendants had produced ownership certificates and argued that the constructions subject to demolition were not unauthorised . The bailiff decided to stay the enforcement proceedings until clarification was provided .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed this request , finding that the judgment of DATE had clearly stated that , according to ORG letter of DATE , the neighbours had unlawfully seized part of the applicant ’s plot of land measuring CARDINAL sq . m , not including the walls , and QUANTITY . m , if including the walls , on which they had built unauthorised constructions which were to be removed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff decided to resume the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the head bailiff applied to PERSON , requesting that the unauthorised constructions built by the defendants be pointed out on the spot .

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE PERSON Council informed the head bailiff that , in accordance with additional measurements taken by the employees of ORG with the participation of the bailiff , no unauthorised constructions built by the neighbours were disclosed on the applicant ’s plot of land . As to the letter of DATE , it referred to a land seizure of QUANTITY . m at the rear of the plot of land which was separated by an uncemented fence that could have been removed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff decided to discontinue the enforcement proceedings on the ground that , as a result of additional measuring , no unauthorised constructions and land seizure had been disclosed in the disputed area and that the unauthorised constructions referred to in the execution writ were the ORG flats .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant complained about the bailiff ’s decision to the courts claiming that the judgment of DATE had not been complied with and seeking to annul the bailiff ’s decision and to resume the enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG and ORG of GPE granted the complaint , quashed the bailiff ’s decision as being in contradiction to LAW of the PERSON on ORG ( “ the Enforcement Law ” ) and ordered the reopening of the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff reopened the enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the head bailiff applied to ORG , asking for additional measurements to be taken , with participation of specialists and bailiffs , in order to clarify the existence of unauthorised constructions built by the defendants and the dimensions of the seized land on the spot .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the Head of ORG of ORG informed the bailiff that there were no unauthorised constructions and no unlawful land seizure on the applicant ’s plot of land by his neighbours .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff decided , based on the above letter , to discontinue the enforcement proceedings on the ground that there were no unauthorised constructions and no unlawful land seizure at the address in question .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant contested this decision before the courts . On DATE the ORG and ORG of GPE quashed the bailiff ’s decision on the ground that the bailiff had failed to enforce in substance the judgment of DATE and that his actions were in violation of LAW of LAW .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the bailiff lodged an appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff , based on the judgment of ORG , reopened the enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Head of the Kanaker - Zeytun District Council , upon a request lodged by the bailiff on DATE , informed the latter that , in accordance with the examination carried out by the ORG ’s officials , the actual size of the houses built by the applicant ’s neighbours on their plots of land corresponded to that indicated in their ownership certificates .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG and ORG of ORG , upon a request lodged by the bailiff on DATE , informed the latter that its officials had taken measurements of the applicant ’s house and plot of land , as a result of which it was found that the actual position and size of the applicant ’s house and the plot of land corresponded to the plan as indicated in the ownership certificate .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff again requested ORG to provide clarification of the execution writ .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff decided to stay the enforcement proceedings on this ground .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff applied to ORG , seeking to clarify whether the enforcement proceedings were to be discontinued or terminated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed this application .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the bailiff decided to reopen the enforcement proceedings and to terminate them , finding that the uncemented construction ( fence ) built by the defendants without authorisation at the rear of the plot had been removed .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant contested before the courts the bailiff ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE , claiming that it was in violation of LAW § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW since the final judgment of DATE had not actually been enforced .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG and ORG of GPE dismissed the applicant ’s complaint . The applicant lodged an appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . In doing so , ORG made a reference to ORG letter of DATE , according to which the land seizure concerned the uncemented fence which was no longer found to be present during a new on - site examination on DATE . Hence , the judgment of DATE had in fact been enforced by DATE . The bailiff ’s decision to discontinue the enforcement proceedings was quashed on formal grounds , in particular , because the bailiff had not applied the correct legal provision for the termination of the enforcement proceedings , and not because the judgment had not been enforced . It would have been more correct to terminate the proceedings rather than to discontinue them . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law against the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not submit any further information concerning the case .
CARDINAL . The PERSON on the Enforcement of Judicial Acts
CARDINAL . According to LAW , the enforcement of judicial acts in GPE is ensured by ORG operating under ORG of GPE .
CARDINAL . According to LAW , an execution writ issued according to a procedure prescribed by this PERSON shall provide grounds for taking enforcement measures .
CARDINAL . According to LAW ( as amended on DATE ) , enforcement measures include , inter alia , imposition of a fine for failure to comply with the bailiff ’s decisions .
CARDINAL . According to LAW and DATE , the enforcement measures shall be executed within DATE . This time - limit can be extended by DATE by ORG of GPE .
CARDINAL . According to LAW , if the requirements contained in the execution writ are unclear the bailiff can apply to obtain clarification from the court which issued the writ .
CARDINAL . According to LAW , the bailiff has the right to stay the enforcement proceedings if he has applied to obtain clarification from the court which issued the execution writ .

CARDINAL . According to LAW , the bailiff shall discontinue the enforcement proceedings if ( CARDINAL ) the judgment beneficiary requests that the execution writ be withdrawn ; ( CARDINAL ) it is impossible to locate the debtor or his property while all permissible measures taken by the bailiff and/or the beneficiary have proved vain ; ( CARDINAL ) the debtor has no property or sources of income which might be confiscated while all the permissible measures undertaken by the bailiff and/or the beneficiary and directed at discovering the debtor ’s property have proved vain ; and ( CARDINAL ) the debtor ’s property is not sufficient to meet the demands of the beneficiary ; and ( CARDINAL ) the enforcement activities , as required by the execution writ , have been concluded ( this subparagraph was abolished on DATE ) .
CARDINAL . According to LAW , the bailiff shall terminate the enforcement proceedings if the execution writ has in fact been executed .

CARDINAL . According to LAW ( as in force at the material time ) , following the institution of enforcement proceedings the bailiff shall set a time - limit for the execution by the debtor of the execution writ obliging him to take certain actions . If no actions are taken within that time - limit , the bailiff shall impose on the debtor a fine and take other measures envisaged under LAW and ensure the enforcement of the execution writ by levying on the debtor CARDINAL times the enforcement costs .

CARDINAL . According to LAW and CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( as amended on DATE ) , the deliberate non - compliance with the bailiff ’s decision entails liability prescribed by law . Fines imposed by the bailiff shall be levied by a court judgment .

CARDINAL . According to Article CARDINAL ( as amended on DATE ) , the deliberate non - compliance with the bailiff ’s decision shall lead to the imposition of a fine between QUANTITY times the fixed minimum wage .
